intro: Anemia dimorphostachys, commonly known as the two-stemmed anemia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its distinctive two-branched inflorescence. The plant produces small, violet-colored flowers that bloom during the spring and summer seasons. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Anemia dimorphostachys is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
